[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_transaction_outputs()] [Status Clone] Line 410 clones the transaction status - can modifications to the original status after cloning create inconsistencies in the returned data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_persisted_auxiliary_info_iterator()] [Iterator Bounds] Does the iterator properly enforce num_persisted_auxiliary_info as a hard limit, or can it return more items if the database contains them? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_persisted_auxiliary_info_iterator()] [No Pruning Check] Unlike other functions, this doesn't call error_if_ledger_pruned before creating the iterator - can this return pruned data or fail unexpectedly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_persisted_auxiliary_info_iterator()] [Unchecked Start Version] Is start_version validated to be within reasonable bounds before creating the iterator, or can u64::MAX cause issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_events()] [Direct Delegation] This function simply delegates to get_events_by_event_key - does this add any value or is it a potential bypass point for access controls? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_events()] [Deprecation Risk] The TODO comment indicates this will be deprecated - can the deprecation process introduce security gaps where old and new APIs behave differently? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_transaction_iterator()] [Iterator Lifetime] The returned iterator has lifetime '_ tied to self - can this create use-after-free scenarios if the AptosDB is dropped while iterators are still in use? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_transaction_iterator()] [Limit Enforcement] Does the iterator respect the limit parameter strictly, or can concurrent writes cause it to return more transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_transaction_iterator()] [Pruning During Iteration] If pruning occurs while the iterator is active, can this cause the iterator to skip transactions or panic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_transaction_info_iterator()] [Transaction Info Consistency] Can the transaction info returned by this iterator become inconsistent with actual transactions if they're modified during iteration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_transaction_info_iterator()] [Cast to usize] Line 506 casts limit from u64 to usize - can this truncate on 32-bit systems, returning fewer items than requested? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_events_iterator()] [Events Per Version] This returns Vec<ContractEvent> per version - can an attacker cause memory exhaustion by creating transactions with thousands of events? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_events_iterator()] [Empty Event Lists] Does the iterator return empty vectors for versions with no events, or skip those versions - can this cause iteration count mismatches? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_write_set_iterator()] [Write Set Size] Can an attacker cause DoS by requesting iterators over versions with extremely large write sets (e.g., genesis or major state changes)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_write_set_iterator()] [Access Control] Does this function have any access controls to prevent unauthorized users from reading sensitive state changes in write sets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_transaction_accumulator_range_proof()] [Proof Range Validation] Does get_transaction_range_proof validate that first_version + limit <= ledger_version, or can this generate invalid proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_transaction_accumulator_range_proof()] [Some() Wrapper] Line 559 wraps first_version in Some() - what happens if first_version is None in the underlying call, can this change proof semantics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_epoch_ending_ledger_info()] [Version Validation] Does this validate that the version actually corresponds to an epoch ending, or can it return ledger info for non-epoch-ending versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_epoch_ending_ledger_info()] [Missing Epoch] What happens if the requested version is in the middle of an epoch - does this error appropriately or return incorrect data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_epoch_ending_ledger_info_iterator()] [Limit Saturation] At lines 579-583, saturating_sub and saturating_add are used - can these saturating operations hide overflow conditions that should be errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_epoch_ending_ledger_info_iterator()] [End Epoch Recalculation] Line 583 recalculates end_epoch - can this create confusion where the iterator returns different epochs than requested? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_epoch_ending_ledger_info_iterator()] [Request Validation] Does check_epoch_ending_ledger_infos_request at line 578 prevent all invalid requests, or can some edge cases slip through? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_reader.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_with_ledger_info()] [Epoch Calculation] Line 610 gets the epoch for known_version - can this fail or return wrong epoch if known_version is at an epoch boundary? (High)
